com.vijfhart.casus.tree.comparator

Class NodeComparator<E extends Node<E>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vijfhart.casus.tree.comparator.NodeComparator<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Comparator<E>

    public class NodeComparator<E extends Node<E>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Comparator<E>
    Compares the relative position of two nodes in a tree-like structure. Can be used to maintain the order of the nodes in a tree.
    Author:
    Dirk Luijk

    • Constructor Detail

      • NodeComparator

        public NodeComparator()

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public int compare(E node1,
          E node2)
        Compares two nodes, based on their relative position. - When parent-child, levels are compared. - When siblings, it compares using toString or uses the siblings comparator. - When same level, compare parents. - When different levels, use the parent of the node furtherst removed from the root.
        Specified by:
        compare in interface java.util.Comparator<E extends Node<E>>

      • setSiblingsComparator

        public void setSiblingsComparator(java.util.Comparator<E> siblingsComparator)
        Sets a new comparator to compare siblings.
        Parameters:
        siblingsComparator - The new comparator to use.
